item.title: Inside Claude Code Skills: Structure, prompts, invocation
item.description: Claude Code recently added skills as an extensibility mechanism alongside MCP servers and slash commands. While MCP servers add new tools and slash commands provide pre-defined prompts, skills expand prompts on demand with task-specific instructions and local helpers.

item.title: Inside Claude Code's Web Tools: WebFetch vs WebSearch
item.description: Claude Code is a popular coding assistant. The tool isn’t open-source, so I inspected its runtime behavior to understand the internals. This post documents what I’ve seen in the two “web” tools—WebFetch and WebSearch—and how they’re designed. The post is written for agent builders and curious developers.

item.title: Claude Code 2.0 System Prompt Changes
item.description: Claude Code 2.0 launched in September 2025, powered by Sonnet 4.5 which Anthropic calls the “best coding model in the world.” The announcement focused on checkpoints and the new VS Code extension, but the underlying prompt and tools changed as well.
